description: Students study the contemporary American family as it meets the challenge of a changing social world. The primary objective is to enlarge both personal and intellectual understanding of the complex issues facing families. Using the range of behavioral sciences concerned with family life, students study the interaction of individuals within families and families within society. Primary emphasis is on theories and practice of family communication. Offered each semester. Also counts toward women's and gender studies major and educational studies and women's and gender studies concentrations.
name: Family Relationships
notes: This course has class-year limits. Not open to first-year students.
